issue.title: format_to must not copy models of output_iterator<const charT&>

discussion.p: specifies the overloads of format_to as:

blockquote.pre: using context = basic_format_context<Out, decltype(fmt)::value_type>; return vformat_to(out, fmt, make_format_args<context>(args...));
using context = basic_format_context<Out, decltype(fmt)::value_type>; return vformat_to(out, loc, fmt, make_format_args<context>(args...));

discussion.p: but the overloads of vformat_to take their first argument by value (from the same subclause):

blockquote.p:
-10- Let charT be decltype(fmt)::value_type.
-11- Constraints: Out satisfies output_iterator<const charT&>.
-12- Preconditions: Out models output_iterator<const charT&>.

discussion.p: and require its type to model output_iterator<const charT&>. output_iterator<T, U> refines input_or_output_iterator<T> which refines movable<T>, but it notably does not refine copyable<T>. Consequently, the "Equivalent to" code for the format_to overloads is copying an iterator that could be move-only. I suspect it is not the intent that calls to format_to with move-only iterators be ill-formed, but that it was simply an oversight that this wording needs updating to be consistent with the change to allow move-only single-pass iterators in C++20.
Set status to Tentatively Ready after seven votes in favour during reflector poll.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4885.

blockquote.pre: using context = basic_format_context<Out, decltype(fmt)::value_type>; return vformat_to(std::move(out), fmt, make_format_args<context>(args...));
using context = basic_format_context<Out, decltype(fmt)::value_type>; return vformat_to(std::move(out), loc, fmt, make_format_args<context>(args...));
